body: Yes, this is because I haven't implemented setting attributes yet.  It should be straight forward enough though.

issue.title: Using rclone to write to a google drive crypt mount fails

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
rclone -V
rclone v1.35-137-ge2f0feeβ

In my case /data/Media3 is a google mount crypt.  I am trying to write to it and replace files:
 ```rclone --delete-before --stats 0 --config=$RCLONECONF --transfers=16 --checkers=64 copy -vv -c $OPT /data/Media1/Videos/Series/Van.Helsing/tvshow.nfo /data/Media3/
2017/03/02 08:42:34 NOTICE: Config file "" not found - using defaults
2017/03/02 08:42:34 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.35-137-ge2f0feeβ" starting with parameters ["rclone" "--delete-before" "--stats" "0" "--config=" "--transfers=16" "--checkers=64" "copy" "-vv" "-c" "/data/Media1/Videos/Series/Van.Helsing/tvshow.nfo" "/data/Media3/"]
2017/03/02 08:42:34 INFO  : Local file system at /data/Media3: Modify window is 1ns
2017/03/02 08:42:34 INFO  : Local file system at /data/Media3: Waiting for checks to finish
2017/03/02 08:42:34 DEBUG : tvshow.nfo: MD5 = 21823f62fb2822d14c7b42c15fed58b1 (Local file system at /data/Media1/Videos/Series/Van.Helsing)
2017/03/02 08:42:34 DEBUG : tvshow.nfo: MD5 = 73758a0d8836f93e88ebda6f20f14bf3 (Local file system at /data/Media3)
2017/03/02 08:42:34 DEBUG : tvshow.nfo: MD5 differ
2017/03/02 08:42:34 INFO  : Local file system at /data/Media3: Waiting for transfers to finish
2017/03/02 08:42:34 ERROR : tvshow.nfo: Failed to copy: open /data/Media3/tvshow.nfo: input/output error
2017/03/02 08:42:34 ERROR : Attempt 1/3 failed with 1 errors and: open /data/Media3/tvshow.nfo: input/output error
```

If I remove that file first and then retry the write it succeeds... Sort of.  It writes the file but then can't change the times.  
```
 rclone --delete-before --stats 0 --config=$RCLONECONF --transfers=16 --checkers=64 copy -vv -c $OPT /data/Media1/Videos/Series/Van.Helsing/tvshow.nfo /data/Media3/
2017/03/02 08:47:13 NOTICE: Config file "" not found - using defaults
2017/03/02 08:47:13 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.35-137-ge2f0feeβ" starting with parameters ["rclone" "--delete-before" "--stats" "0" "--config=" "--transfers=16" "--checkers=64" "copy" "-vv" "-c" "/data/Media1/Videos/Series/Van.Helsing/tvshow.nfo" "/data/Media3/"]
2017/03/02 08:47:13 INFO  : Local file system at /data/Media3: Modify window is 1ns
2017/03/02 08:47:13 INFO  : Local file system at /data/Media3: Waiting for checks to finish
2017/03/02 08:47:13 INFO  : Local file system at /data/Media3: Waiting for transfers to finish
2017/03/02 08:47:13 ERROR : tvshow.nfo: Failed to copy: chtimes /data/Media3/tvshow.nfo: operation not permitted
2017/03/02 08:47:13 ERROR : Attempt 1/3 failed with 1 errors and: chtimes /data/Media3/tvshow.nfo: operation not permitted
2017/03/02 08:47:13 INFO  : Local file system at /data/Media3: Waiting for checks to finish
2017/03/02 08:47:13 DEBUG : tvshow.nfo: Size and MD5 of src and dst objects identical
2017/03/02 08:47:13 DEBUG : tvshow.nfo: Unchanged skipping
2017/03/02 08:47:13 INFO  : Local file system at /data/Media3: Waiting for transfers to finish
2017/03/02 08:47:13 ERROR : Attempt 2/3 succeeded
2017/03/02 08:47:13 DEBUG : Go routines at exit 2
2017/03/02 08:47:13 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.35-137-ge2f0feeβ" finishing with parameters ["rclone" "--delete-before" "--stats" "0" "--config=" "--transfers=16" "--checkers=64" "copy" "-vv" "-c" "/data/Media1/Videos/Series/Van.Helsing/tvshow.nfo" "/data/Media3/"]

ls -l /data/Media3/tvshow.nfo
-rw-rw-r-- 1 deluge mediashare 4972 Mar  1 17:42 /data/Media3/tvshow.nfo

```
I can replicate that.  So this is a mount restriction.  Should it be?
```
touch -r /data/Media1/Videos/Series/Van.Helsing/tvshow.nfo /data/Media3/tvshow.nfo
touch: setting times of ‘/data/Media3/tvshow.nfo’: Operation not permitted

```
I am not 100% sure that the failure in the first example is the same as the times issue but i'd suspect it has something to do with it.  I see two options, allow hte changing of hte time stamps (which google drive allows I believe) or have a flag(s) to disable the destination time modification.

rclone, however, should be able to write correctly to its own mount. :)  I would think the right approach would be to have the mount update the times if possible.  I think some of the underlying storage supports this (local does and gdrive?).  For ones that do not support this, perhaps the fuse/mount should silently fail instead of throwing errors?

body:
Oh okay. Since it said ModTime yes on the [Features Overview of cloud storage systems](http://rclone.org/overview/) I assumed it was already implemented. No wonder that I couldn't get it to work even after trying for so many hours.

Is there any ETA (like some weeks or several months) for this? Because quite a few things depend on those dates for me and I can't afford to lose all the timestamps for terabytes of data.
Copy the data up using `rclone copy` or `rclone sync` instead which has much better retry logic and will preserve the mod time right now.

This has been done in this beta

http://beta.rclone.org/v1.36-06-g4dc030d/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Thanks for the fast implementation ncw!

But I still got some problems :/

When using Finder to copy files it says "no such file or directory", but I can click skip after each file and it's uploaded with the correct timestamp anyway.

When using the terminal with "cp -a image.jpg gdc/" it shows this:
`cp: preserving times for 'gdc/image.jpg': No such file or directory`

The file is uploaded, but the timestamp not set.

Log when copying a file with macOS Finder:
```
2017/03/24 21:52:06 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.36-DEV" starting with parameters ["rclone" "mount" "-vv" "gdc:" "gdc"]
2017/03/24 21:52:06 DEBUG : pacer: Rate limited, sleeping for 1.94777941s (1 consecutive low level retries)

2017/03/24 21:52:09 DEBUG : pacer: Resetting sleep to minimum 10ms on success

2017/03/24 21:52:11 DEBUG : Encrypted Google drive root 'rclone': Mounting on "gdc"
2017/03/24 21:52:11 DEBUG : Encrypted Google drive root 'rclone': Root()
2017/03/24 21:52:11 DEBUG : : Dir.Attr valid=1m0s ino=0 size=0 mode=drwxr-xr-x

2017/03/24 21:52:12 DEBUG : : Dir.Attr valid=1m0s ino=0 size=0 mode=drwxr-xr-x
2017/03/24 21:52:20 DEBUG : image.jpg: Dir.Lookup
2017/03/24 21:52:20 DEBUG : : Reading directory
2017/03/24 21:52:20 DEBUG : Google drive root 'rclone': Reading ""
2017/03/24 21:52:20 DEBUG : Google drive root 'rclone': Finished reading ""

```

Log when copying a file with the terminal:
```
2017/03/24 21:56:59 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.36-DEV" starting with parameters ["rclone" "mount" "-vv" "gdc:" "gdc"]
2017/03/24 21:57:00 INFO  : Encrypted Google drive root 'rclone': Modify window is 1ms

2017/03/24 21:57:00 DEBUG : : Dir.Attr valid=1m0s ino=0 size=0 mode=drwxr-xr-x

2017/03/24 21:57:03 DEBUG : Google drive root 'rclone': Reading ""
2017/03/24 21:57:03 DEBUG : Google drive root 'rclone': Finished reading ""

2017/03/24 21:57:03 DEBUG : File.Attr valid=1m0s ino=0 size=0 mode=-rw-r--r--
2017/03/24 21:57:03 DEBUG : image.jpg: WriteFileHandle.Write len=960729
2017/03/24 21:57:03 DEBUG : : Dir.Attr valid=1m0s ino=0 size=0 mode=drwxr-xr-x
2017/03/24 21:57:03 DEBUG : .hidden: Dir.Lookup
2017/03/24 21:57:03 DEBUG : .hidden: Dir.Lookup
2017/03/24 21:57:03 DEBUG : .hidden: Dir.Lookup
2017/03/24 21:57:04 DEBUG : image.jpg: WriteFileHandle.Write OK (960729 bytes written)
2017/03/24 21:57:04 DEBUG : File.Attr valid=1m0s ino=0 size=960729 mode=-rw-r--r--
2017/03/24 21:57:09 DEBUG : File.Attr valid=1m0s ino=0 size=960729 mode=-rw-r--r--
2017/03/24 21:57:14 DEBUG : image.jpg: WriteFileHandle.Flush
2017/03/24 21:57:15 DEBUG : image.jpg: WriteFileHandle.Flush OK
2017/03/24 21:57:15 DEBUG : image.jpg: WriteFileHandle.Release nothing to do
2017/03/24 21:57:15 DEBUG : image.jpg: File.Attr valid=1m0s ino=0 size=960729 mode=-rw-r--r--
^C
2017/03/24 21:57:20 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.36-DEV" finishing with parameters ["rclone" "mount" "-vv" "gdc:" "gdc"]
```

I can't take the credit it was entirely @breunigs 

@breunigs - fancy taking a look?

Yes, I will. Not before the weekend, though. (Although my initial hunch is some time of race condition – it failed in similar ways when I tested locally using something similar to `echo "Asd" > testfile && touch -m testfile` because `testfile` did not yet appear in the directory listing. Let's see if that's the source, and how to work around that)

I couldn't sleep, so… Anyway, this appears to be an issue of how cp orders its syscalls:
```
cp         rclone
--         ------
write      File.Open + newWriteFileHandle + WriteFileHandle.Write
utimensat  File.Setattr # fails, because file.o is still nil
close      WriteFileHandle.Flush + close # this is when the upload
           finishes, and I get file.o
```

So, essentially a dead lock.

There's three ways I see:
1. force a Flush/close the file, so I could obtain `o`. Apart from the issue of finding the WriteFileHandle, this would probably cause errors when `cp` calls `close`. I discarded that idea.

2. Running `Setattr` async when needed. I wrote a patch for this approach, that appears to work:
https://github.com/breunigs/rclone/commit/96702a5d606920f8cb948c3f271e9d91eb2f7864 

The patch is huge mostly due to refactoring and left-in debug output. There's only two important bits: `setModTime` gets called async if there is no `o`, but there are still writers. To avoid a race condition, I had to move decrementing the writers counter until after we close the pipe and finish the writing call.

Obviously, the async code path is rather brittle: if finishing up writing takes too long, setting the attribute will timeout and fail, but the code pretended earlier that everything was fine. All in all I don't think this is a good approach.

3. Queuing up to 1 setAttr call (or just modTime for now) and resolving that once `fh.file.setObject(fh.o)` gets called. It might be possible to even hand down the error in this scenario (i.e. "failed to write attributes" error on flush/closeing the file. I'll have to give that some more thought first).

issue.title: allow modTime to be changed even before all writers are closed (fixes #1197 -- again)

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
This is "proposal 3" from my [previous comment](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/1197#issuecomment-289964080). I decided not to hand down error until there's an actual bug reported that warrants complicating the error handling in `WriteFileHandle.close`. 

It fixes not only the `cp -a` issue, but also the stale cache issue that would result in the dir listing showing a wrong timestamp for some time directly after copying. 

Cheers
Stefan

body:
Thank you so much @breunigs and sorry for crediting the wrong person, I'm not that used to GitHub and didn't notice the commit came from another person. I'm really grateful for your help and the fast implementation and also @ncw for making rclone happen in the first place.

For 2 hours now I tried to produce any errors. Copying a lot of small files, using rsync -aP, copying files >1GB with Finder - this implementation works flawlessly. All timestamps are preserved now :)

Still noticed one error which occurs when a lot of small files are involved (50 files, 36 MB, operation duration 4 min):

```
$ cp -aR test gdc/
cp: failed to close 'gdc/test/42.png': Input/output error
cp: failed to close 'gdc/test/34.jpg': Input/output error
```

```
$ rclone mount -v gdc: ~/gdc
2017/04/01 22:24:21 INFO  : Encrypted Google drive root 'rclone': Modify window is 1ms
2017/04/01 22:26:15 ERROR : test/42.png: WriteFileHandle.Flush error: googleapi: Error 403: Rate Limit Exceeded, rateLimitExceeded
2017/04/01 22:27:56 ERROR : test/34.jpg: WriteFileHandle.Flush error: googleapi: Error 403: Rate Limit Exceeded, rateLimitExceeded
```

But I don't think it has something to with your code and happened before already. But now that timestamps are preserved I'm finally motivated to dig into the documentation and hopefully find something to prevent this from happening - maybe there are some flags for retries, rate limits or any other option so Finder honors the I/O fails and doesn't just continue it's work as if nothing happened, because right now this results in data loss when I move files instead of creating just a copy.
@ms-89 thanks for testing.  The rate limit exceeded unfortunately are a fact of life with drive uploads.  This will get fixed for uploads when they are cached on disk first which is planned in #711
